entries.title: Google Workspace Module Settings
entries.summary: Configuration options for the Google Workspace integration
entries.content:
Configure Google Workspace integration in Settings > Modules > Google Workspace.

**Required Settings**:
- **Service Account JSON**: Upload your Google Cloud service account key file
- **Admin Email**: Super admin email for domain-wide delegation (e.g., admin@yourdomain.com)
- **Domain**: Your Google Workspace domain (e.g., yourdomain.com)

**Optional Settings**:
- **Auto-sync Enabled**: Enable automatic synchronization (default: true)
- **Sync Interval**: How often to sync (5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 1 hour, daily)
- **Sync Users**: Enable user synchronization (default: true)
- **Sync Groups**: Enable group synchronization (default: true)
- **Sync OrgUnits**: Enable organizational unit synchronization (default: true)

**Status Indicators**:
- Connected: Green checkmark when successfully connected
- Last Sync: Timestamp of most recent sync
- Sync Status: Success, Failed, or In Progress

entries.title: Microsoft 365 Module Settings
entries.summary: Configuration options for the Microsoft 365 integration
entries.content:
Configure Microsoft 365 integration in Settings > Modules > Microsoft 365.

**Required Settings**:
- **Tenant ID**: Your Azure AD tenant/directory ID
- **Client ID**: Application (client) ID from Azure app registration
- **Client Secret**: Secret value from Azure app registration (shown only once when created)

**Optional Settings**:
- **Auto-sync Enabled**: Enable automatic synchronization (default: true)
- **Sync Interval**: How often to sync (5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 1 hour, daily)
- **Sync Users**: Enable user synchronization (default: true)
- **Sync Groups**: Enable group synchronization (default: true)
- **Sync Licenses**: Enable license synchronization (default: true)

**Status Indicators**:
- Connected: Green checkmark when successfully connected
- Last Sync: Timestamp of most recent sync
- Sync Status: Success, Failed, or In Progress

entries.title: Sync Settings
entries.summary: Global synchronization settings for all connected platforms
entries.content:
Configure sync behavior in Settings > Advanced > Sync Settings.

**Sync Interval Options**:
- 5 minutes: Near real-time (highest API usage)
- 15 minutes: Default, good balance
- 30 minutes: Reduced API usage
- 1 hour: Low API usage
- Daily: Minimum API usage

**Conflict Resolution**:
- **Platform Wins**: Helios data takes precedence on conflicts
- **Source Wins**: Google/Microsoft data takes precedence (default)

**Advanced Options**:
- **Delta Sync**: Only sync changes since last sync (faster, recommended)
- **Full Sync**: Sync all data every time (slower, use for troubleshooting)

**Manual Sync**:
Trigger immediate sync from the Dashboard or Settings > Advanced.

entries.title: AI Assistant Settings
entries.summary: Configuration options for the AI Assistant feature
entries.content:
Configure AI Assistant in Settings > Modules > AI Assistant.

**General Settings**:
- **Enable AI Assistant**: Toggle to enable/disable the AI chat feature
- **Custom System Prompt**: Override the default AI behavior with custom instructions

**MCP Tools**:
Enable specific tool categories for AI access:
- **Help & Documentation**: Search help articles and guides
- **Commands**: Look up Developer Console commands
- **Reports**: Generate user and group reports
- **User Data**: Query live user data (read-only)
- **Group Data**: Query live group data (read-only)

**LLM Provider**:
Configure your AI provider credentials:
- **Provider**: Anthropic (Claude) or OpenAI (GPT)
- **API Key**: Your provider API key
- **Model**: Specific model version to use

**Usage Limits**:
- **Max Messages/Day**: Limit AI usage per user (0 = unlimited)
- **Max Tokens/Request**: Maximum response length

entries.title: Organization Settings
entries.summary: Basic organization configuration settings
entries.content:
Configure your organization in Settings > Organization.

**General Settings**:
- **Organization Name**: Display name for your organization
- **Primary Domain**: Main domain for your organization
- **Logo**: Upload organization logo for branding
- **Time Zone**: Default time zone for the organization

**Branding**:
- **Primary Color**: Main accent color for the UI
- **Logo (Light)**: Logo for light theme
- **Logo (Dark)**: Logo for dark theme

**Contact Information**:
- **Admin Email**: Primary admin contact email
- **Support Email**: Support contact email (if different)

**Organization Domains**:
Manage email domains that belong to your organization (see setting-organization-domains).

entries.title: Organization Domains
entries.summary: Configure email domains that belong to your organization for user classification
entries.content:
Manage organization email domains in Settings > Organization (scroll down).

**Purpose**:
Domains determine whether users are classified as 'staff' (internal) or 'guests' (external) based on their email addresses.

**Domain Types**:
- **Primary**: Your main organization domain. Cannot be removed.
- **Alias**: Additional domains your organization owns. Can be added/removed.

**Adding a Domain**:
1. Go to Settings > Organization
2. Scroll to 'Organization Domains'
3. Enter the domain (e.g., example.com)
4. Click 'Add Domain'
5. Users with this domain are automatically reclassified as staff

**Removing a Domain**:
1. Find the domain in the list
2. Click the trash icon
3. Confirm removal
4. Users with this domain become guests

**Initial Setup**:
Domains are automatically seeded from existing user emails when the system is first configured.

**Classification Logic**:
- Email domain matches organization domain = Staff
- Email domain does not match = Guest
- Contacts are always external (not classified)

entries.title: Security Settings
entries.summary: Security and authentication configuration
entries.content:
Configure security settings in Settings > Security.

**Password Policy**:
- **Minimum Length**: Minimum password characters (default: 8)
- **Require Uppercase**: Require at least one uppercase letter
- **Require Number**: Require at least one number
- **Require Special Character**: Require at least one special character
- **Expiration Days**: Password expiration period (0 = never expires)

**Session Settings**:
- **Access Token Expiry**: JWT token lifetime (default: 8 hours)
- **Refresh Token Expiry**: Refresh token lifetime (default: 7 days)
- **Max Sessions**: Maximum concurrent sessions per user (0 = unlimited)

**Account Lockout**:
- **Max Failed Attempts**: Failed logins before lockout (default: 5)
- **Lockout Duration**: How long account remains locked (default: 15 minutes)

**Two-Factor Authentication** (Coming Soon):
- Enable/require 2FA for users
- Supported methods: TOTP, SMS

entries.title: Audit Log Settings
entries.summary: Configure audit log retention and export settings
entries.content:
Configure audit logging in Settings > Security > Audit Logs.

**Retention Settings**:
- **Retention Period**: How long to keep logs (default: 90 days)
- **Extended Retention**: Enterprise plans support 1 year+

**Log Level**:
- **Standard**: User logins, admin actions, configuration changes
- **Detailed**: All standard events plus API requests, sync events
- **Debug**: All detailed events plus system internals (not recommended for production)

**Export Settings**:
- **Format**: CSV or JSON
- **Include PII**: Whether to include personally identifiable information
- **Compression**: Enable ZIP compression for large exports

**Notifications**:
- **Email Alerts**: Send email on security events
- **Alert Recipients**: Email addresses to notify

entries.title: API Key Settings
entries.summary: Configure API key behavior and limits
entries.content:
Configure API keys in Settings > Integrations.

**Key Types**:
- **Service Key**: Full API access for backend integrations
- **Vendor Key**: Limited access for third-party tools

**Key Settings**:
- **Default Expiration**: Default expiry for new keys (30, 60, 90 days, 1 year, never)
- **Max Keys Per User**: Maximum API keys per admin user
- **Require Description**: Require description when creating keys

**Rate Limits**:
- **Requests Per Minute**: Default rate limit (100/min)
- **Requests Per Day**: Daily limit (0 = unlimited)

**Security**:
- **Require IP Whitelist**: Restrict key usage to specific IPs
- **Log All Requests**: Log every API request (increases audit log size)

entries.title: User Preferences
entries.summary: Personal user settings and preferences
entries.content:
Configure personal preferences in your User Settings (click avatar > Settings).

**Appearance**:
- **Theme**: Light, Dark, or System (follows OS preference)
- **Compact Mode**: Reduce spacing for more content
- **Sidebar Collapsed**: Start with collapsed sidebar

**Notifications**:
- **Email Notifications**: Receive email for important events
- **Desktop Notifications**: Browser push notifications
- **Digest Emails**: Daily or weekly summary emails

**Regional Settings**:
- **Time Zone**: Your local time zone
- **Date Format**: MM/DD/YYYY, DD/MM/YYYY, or YYYY-MM-DD
- **Language**: Interface language (English currently)

**Dashboard**:
- **Default View**: Admin or User view on login
- **Widget Layout**: Customize dashboard widgets

entries.title: Email Signature Settings
entries.summary: Configure email signature templates and deployment
entries.content:
Configure email signatures in Settings > Signatures.

**Template Settings**:
- **Default Template**: Template applied to new users
- **Template Lock**: Prevent users from modifying signatures

**Deployment Settings**:
- **Auto-Deploy**: Automatically deploy signatures on sync
- **Deploy Schedule**: When to push signature updates

**Tracking Settings**:
- **Enable Tracking**: Add tracking pixels to signatures
- **Track Opens**: Monitor when emails are opened
- **Tracking Domain**: Custom domain for tracking pixels

**Campaign Settings**:
- **Campaign Mode**: Enable promotional campaigns in signatures
- **Campaign Rotation**: How to select active campaigns

entries.title: Environment Variables
entries.summary: Server-side environment configuration variables
entries.content:
Environment variables are configured in the `.env` file or server environment.

**Required Variables**:
- `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_NAME`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`: Database connection
- `JWT_SECRET`: Secret for JWT token signing (min 32 characters)
- `ENCRYPTION_KEY`: Key for encrypting sensitive data (min 32 characters)

**Optional Variables**:
- `PUBLIC_URL`: Public URL for the application (e.g., https://helios.yourdomain.com)
- `FRONTEND_URL`: Frontend URL if different from PUBLIC_URL
- `PORT`: Backend API port (default: 3001)
- `NODE_ENV`: Environment mode (development, production, test)

**Redis Settings**:
- `REDIS_HOST`: Redis server host (default: localhost)
- `REDIS_PORT`: Redis server port (default: 6379)

**S3/MinIO Settings**:
- `S3_ENDPOINT`: S3-compatible storage endpoint
- `S3_ACCESS_KEY`: Storage access key
- `S3_SECRET_KEY`: Storage secret key
- `S3_BUCKET`: Default bucket name

entries.title: Feature Flags Settings
entries.summary: Enable or disable specific features and navigation items
entries.content:
Feature flags allow you to control which features are visible and enabled.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Feature Flags.

**Navigation Flags**:
Control which menu items appear in the sidebar:
- **Onboarding**: Show/hide onboarding templates
- **Offboarding**: Show/hide offboarding templates
- **Signatures**: Show/hide email signatures
- **Scheduled Actions**: Show/hide scheduled actions
- **IT Assets**: Show/hide IT asset management
- **Files Section**: Show/hide built-in file storage (MinIO - NOT Google Drive)
- **Shared Files**: Public assets with shareable URLs
- **My Files**: Personal user file storage
- **Mail Search**: Show/hide email security/search
- **Security Events**: Show/hide security events
- **Audit Logs**: Show/hide audit logs
- **External Sharing**: Show/hide external sharing audit

**Section Flags**:
Control entire navigation sections:
- **Automation Section**: Show/hide all automation features
- **Assets Section**: Show/hide all asset features
- **Security Section**: Show/hide all security features

**Files Note**:
The Files feature uses Helios's built-in MinIO storage. It is completely independent from Google Drive or any workspace platform. Works even without Google Workspace connected.

**Use Cases**:
- Hide features not yet configured
- Simplify UI for smaller organizations
- Gradually roll out new features

entries.title: Master Data Settings
entries.summary: Manage reference data like departments, locations, job titles, and cost centers
entries.content:
Master Data contains the reference values used throughout the organization.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Master Data.

**Departments**:
- Define organizational departments
- Used for user assignment and filtering
- Can sync from Google Workspace or create manually
- Examples: Engineering, Marketing, Sales, HR

**Locations**:
- Define office locations and work sites
- Include address, timezone, and capacity
- Used for user assignment and reporting
- Examples: HQ - New York, Remote, London Office

**Job Titles**:
- Standardize job titles across the organization
- Helps with consistency in user profiles
- Can be used in dynamic group rules
- Examples: Software Engineer, Product Manager, Sales Rep

**Cost Centers**:
- Define financial cost centers
- Used for budget tracking and allocation
- Associate users with cost centers for reporting
- Examples: CC-ENG-001, CC-SALES-002

**Sync Behavior**:
Master data can sync from Google Workspace organizational units or be managed manually in Helios.

entries.title: Entity Labels Settings
entries.summary: Customize terminology used throughout the application
entries.content:
Entity Labels let you customize how entities are named in the UI.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Entity Labels.

**Customizable Labels**:
- **Users**: Change 'Users' to 'Team Members', 'Employees', 'Staff', etc.
- **Groups**: Change 'Groups' to 'Teams', 'Distribution Lists', etc.
- **Departments**: Change 'Departments' to 'Divisions', 'Business Units', etc.
- **Locations**: Change 'Locations' to 'Offices', 'Sites', 'Branches', etc.

**Format Options**:
For each entity, you can set:
- **Singular**: Used when referring to one item (e.g., 'Team Member')
- **Plural**: Used when referring to multiple items (e.g., 'Team Members')

**Visibility**:
You can also hide entity types that aren't relevant to your organization.

**Example Use Cases**:
- University: Change 'Users' to 'Faculty & Staff'
- Law Firm: Change 'Departments' to 'Practice Areas'
- Non-profit: Change 'Cost Centers' to 'Programs'

entries.title: Email Tracking Settings
entries.summary: Configure email signature tracking and analytics
entries.content:
Email Tracking monitors engagement with your email signatures.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Tracking.

**Tracking Options**:
- **Enable Tracking**: Turn tracking on/off globally
- **Track Opens**: Monitor when emails are opened
- **Track Link Clicks**: Monitor when signature links are clicked

**Tracking Pixel**:
A small, invisible image added to signatures that records:
- When the email was opened
- Geographic location (city-level)
- Device type (desktop/mobile)
- Email client

**Privacy Settings**:
- **Anonymize Data**: Don't store recipient email addresses
- **Retention Period**: How long to keep tracking data
- **Honor Do-Not-Track**: Respect browser DNT settings

**Custom Tracking Domain** (Enterprise):
- Use your own domain for tracking pixels
- Improves deliverability
- Example: track.yourdomain.com

**Reports**:
View tracking data in the Signature Analytics dashboard.

entries.title: Administrators Settings
entries.summary: Manage administrator accounts and roles
entries.content:
Manage who has administrative access to Helios.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Administrators.

**Administrator Roles**:
- **Super Admin**: Full access to all features and settings
- **Admin**: Access to most features, cannot manage other admins
- **Helpdesk**: Limited to user management and support tasks
- **Read-Only**: View access only, no modifications

**Adding Administrators**:
1. Click 'Add Administrator'
2. Enter email address
3. Select role
4. User receives invitation email
5. User sets password and activates account

**Managing Access**:
- Change roles at any time
- Revoke access by deactivating account
- View admin activity in audit logs

**Best Practices**:
- Limit Super Admin accounts
- Use role appropriate to responsibilities
- Review admin list regularly
- Enable 2FA for all admins (when available)

entries.title: Paranoid Mode Security
entries.summary: Enhanced security protection against account compromise and insider threats
entries.content:
Paranoid Mode provides layered security protection for your organization.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Security to review and configure security levels.

**Security Levels**:

**Level 0 - Standard**:
- Basic access controls
- Single admin can make all changes
- SSO authentication allowed
- Suitable for small organizations

**Level 1 - Enhanced**:
- All Standard protections
- MFA required for all admins
- Session timeout after 8 hours
- Audit logging enabled

**Level 2 - Paranoid**:
- All Enhanced protections
- Approval Group required for sensitive actions
- Super Admins must use Helios local auth (no SSO)
- 24-hour restriction after password changes
- Critical action approvals from non-admin personnel

**Level 3 - Lockdown**:
- All Paranoid protections
- All admin changes frozen
- Only recovery operations allowed
- Used during active security incidents

**Why No SSO for Super Admins?**
In Paranoid Mode, Super Admins cannot use SSO because if an attacker compromises your Google Workspace, they control SSO. Using separate Helios credentials ensures admins can still access Helios to respond to incidents.

entries.title: Approval Group
entries.summary: Non-admin personnel who verify and approve security-sensitive actions
entries.content:
The Approval Group provides dual-control verification for critical security actions.

**Purpose**:
Approval Group members are trusted personnel (HR, Executives, Finance) who approve sensitive actions. This prevents a compromised admin from making unauthorized changes.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Security > Approval Group.

**Requirements**:
- Minimum 2 members
- At least 1 static member (manually added)
- Not all members can be Super Admins
- Members must use Helios authentication (not SSO)
- MFA required for all members

**Actions Requiring Approval**:
- Adding/removing Super Admins
- Disabling Paranoid Mode
- Changing Approval Group membership
- Deleting admin accounts
- Bulk user operations

**Membership Types**:
- **Static**: Manually added members (always required)
- **Dynamic**: Auto-added based on title rules (CEO, CFO, HR Director)

**Suggested Roles**:
- CEO, COO, President
- HR Director, CHRO
- CFO, Finance Director
- General Counsel, Compliance

**Approval Process**:
1. Admin initiates sensitive action
2. System creates approval request
3. Request posted to Helios Teams Security channel
4. Approval Group member reviews and approves/denies
5. Action executed only after approval

entries.title: Helios Teams
entries.summary: Secure out-of-band communication channel for security coordination
entries.content:
Helios Teams provides a secure communication channel independent of your workspace.

**Purpose**:
When Google Workspace is compromised, work email cannot be trusted. Helios Teams uses Helios local authentication, so it remains accessible when SSO is compromised.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Teams or access via the Teams icon in the header.

**Auto-Created Channels**:

**Security Channel** (auto-created with Approval Group):
- All Approval Group members
- All Super Admins
- Security alerts and notifications
- Approval request notifications
- Cannot add/remove members manually

**Admins Channel** (auto-created with 2+ admins):
- All Super Admins and Admins
- General admin coordination
- Day-to-day communication

**Security Alerts Posted**:
- Password changes detected
- Failed login attempts
- Recovery code usage
- Paranoid Mode changes
- Bulk operations
- Lockdown triggers

**Approval Requests**:
When a sensitive action needs approval, a card is posted to the Security channel with Approve/Deny buttons.

entries.title: Account Recovery Options
entries.summary: Recovery mechanisms when admin accounts are locked or compromised
entries.content:
Helios provides multiple recovery tiers to ensure you can always regain access.

**Access**:
Navigate to Settings > Security > Recovery Options.

**Tier 1: Approval Group Recovery**:
- Fastest recovery method
- Two Approval Group members verify identity
- Out-of-band verification (phone, video call)
- Complete within 1-2 hours
- Must NOT use email or Google

**Tier 2: Recovery Codes**:
- 8 single-use codes generated at setup
- Store in password manager or physical safe
- NOT in Google Drive or work email
- Each code works once
- Generate new codes anytime

**Tier 3: Domain Verification**:
- Last resort when all else fails
- Requires DNS TXT record verification
- Or file upload to domain
- Takes 24-72 hours
- Full audit of recovery action

**24-Hour Restriction**:
After password change or recovery, admins cannot modify other admins or security settings for 24 hours. This prevents attackers who reset a password from immediately taking over.

**Best Practices**:
- Keep at least 3 recovery codes
- Store codes outside Google ecosystem
- Ensure 2+ Approval Group members are reachable
- Test recovery process annually

entries.title: Field Permissions
entries.summary: Who can edit which user profile fields
entries.content:
Field permissions control who can modify user profile information.

**Permission Levels**:

**User Self-Service Fields**:
Users can edit these fields themselves:
- Nickname, Pronouns, Bio
- Personal phone, Emergency contact
- LinkedIn, Twitter, Social links
- Professional designations (CPA, PhD)
- Booking link (Calendly, Cal.com)
- Profile badges and certifications

**HR-Editable Fields** (require HR role or approval):
- Job title, Department, Manager
- Employment type, Start/End dates
- Location, Cost center
- Salary information

**IT-Editable Fields** (require IT role or approval):
- Primary email, Email aliases
- Org unit, License assignments
- Group memberships

**Read-Only from Google**:
- Creation time, Last login
- Is admin, Is delegated admin
- Suspension status

**Change Requests**:
Users can request changes to fields they cannot edit:
1. Click 'Request Change' on the field
2. Enter new value and reason
3. Request routed to HR or IT
4. Approver reviews and approves/denies
5. Change synced to Google Workspace

**Password Change Restrictions**:
In Paranoid Mode, after changing password, admins cannot edit other admin accounts for 24 hours.
